quality labels becomes even more paramount so now data labeling is indeed

that now going further if human workers
when they label the data set the actually make mistakes so they do some incorrect labeling some of those
inaccuracies actually go into your machine learning model and any inaccurate data would cause inaccurate
predictions and some of these have real-world consequences say in the case of autonomous driving examples I talked
about so overall the accuracy of machine learning models is a key aspect and good
data labeling is very important to make that happen now last year we launched
Amazon Sage Maker so this is a managed service that makes it very easy for you
to build train and deploy machine learning models as part of developing
machine learning applications so this service since launch almost like 10,000
customers plus have been using this particular service so you think say it's maker you can take a notebook you can
use that notebook to prepare your data next you can use the first-party
algorithms that we have as part of sage maker then you can use this first-party
algorithms to train machine learning models and then furthermore you can take
these machine learning models and do a one-click deploy to actually do predictions and inference against those
particular models so very simple managed service to do build train and deploy for your machine
learning applications now a lot of customers have been using it so as we talk to these customers one need came
became very apparent as I said earlier like in order to do good machine learning models highly accurate machine
learning models you need the quality label data and given the existing
solutions can't meet their needs so the need was very apparent when we talked to the customers and this is the very
reason that we worked on and launched Amazon said make a ground truth now as
part of Sage maker so sage maker already supported beltrane and deploy as part of
its workflow ground truth data preparation and labeling on top of
that giving you a very well-integrated label train label Bell train deploy flow
as part of Sage maker now the fundamental value propositions behind
ground truth are so first of all it makes data labeling very easy for you
and we'll talk about how it does so the second it reduces the cost for you so
it's very cost efficient the third thing is in terms of accuracy especially
accuracy is again the key behind quality machine learning models so these three
value propositions go behind making sage make a ground truth the solution that we
created around data labeling now let's
start with the three value proposition so I'm going to talk about first ease of use then cost efficiency and accuracy so
in terms of ease of use as part of Sage maker ground truth we support built-in
workflows or labeling tasks now these labeling tasks include
pre-configured UX as well as the flows so as part of creating a labeling job
you can use one of the workflows that you see there and quickly just through
point and click configure a labeling job and get going so as part of the launch
we have for work predefined workflows that we are supporting these are
bounding boxes image classification semantic segmentation and text classification now if you have some more
advanced use cases or you need a lot of customization as part of creating this labeling jobs and labeling tasks you can
use custom tasks which allow you to do the customization of the flows as well
as the UX you can hook in lambda functions as part of the labeling task to do some
pre-processing and post-processing for your labeling job and then use that to
do custom tasks for your labeling applications
now in terms of reducing cost and increasing the accuracy ground truth
uses a combination of active learning and auto data labeling active learning
is a machine learning technique that basically uses a set of algorithms to
decide from your input data sets what subsets of data can be labeled by humans
versus what can be labeled automatically by machine learning models and part of
this is the auto labeling that is done using the machine learning models now
the way ground truth does active learning and Auto date data labeling it
starts with the input data set that you provide so going back to my example of cats versus dogs so you provided an
input data set active learning uses an algorithm to pick up a random set random
subset of images from your data set it sends those images to the human workers
and these human workers actually label those particular images these labelled
images are then used by ground truth to train a machine learning model now the
machine learning model that is trained depends on the task that you are performing or the use case you are you
picked up as part of your labeling job for example if you are doing bounding boxes then we use the first-party
algorithm that is as part of Sage maker which is SSD object detection algorithm to train a machine learning model now as
you get these labels back from the humans a machine learning model is being trained and then ground truth uses this
machine learning model to automatically label a subset of your data set so
incrementally more and more percentage of your objects or images would be labeled by an auto data labeling using
the machine learning model that that is being incremental e trained so next then
ground truth again picks up another subset from your input data set again
senses to humans for labeling the responses that come back in terms of the labels
are then used as part of further training the machine learning model so
this incremental training training as well as labeling continues until the desired accuracy level is achieved or a
stopping condition is reached for example the stopping condition could be like the whole of the data set has been labeled now so this combination of
active learning and auto data labeling the overall objective here is to reduce the amount of human labeling that has to
be performed and the goal is to try to auto label as much of your data set that
can be done so by reducing the overall human labeling the overall cost of the
labeling job that you initiated with ground truth goes down so giving you more cost efficiency as well as the
higher accuracy is achieved because a machine learning model typically would
do better accuracy labeling than say corresponding to humans so this is how a
ground truth achieves a combination of cost efficiency as well as accuracy for your data labeling jobs now when you
configure a labeling job you get a options of different workforces that you
can use as part of configuring the labeling job so presently we support three particular options so you can use
public private or vendor workforces a public workforce is through Amazon
Mechanical Turk so this is like five hundred thousand crowd-sourced workers that you can use to get your labeling
jobs completed now if you are very sensitive about not sending your data set objects to public workers you can
configure a private workforce using ground truth this private workforce uses
a kognito user pool underneath and it supports full authentication or authorization for objects as they are
given to the private workers to work upon now the third option is vendors so
vendors is a curated set of workforce options that we have provided
as part of AWS marketplace these vendors you can use specifically to get work
done if you have very specialized labeling jobs and you need a third-party
vendor workforce to work upon that so I
